Comments_List: I learned a lot more about the interwar period in Japan and the literary motifs present in the era.
I was exposed to a completely new field of knowledge and became very interested in Japan as a result. I am strongly considering learning Japanese language as a result of this course.
Literally, Japanese Modernism, and everything that movement detailed in Japan.
This course was great! I would maybe balance Prof. Jacobowitz's presentations with more discussion, but no major complaints.

Assignments where we have to write about a more specific aspect of the works we read (e. g. Modern girl, mass culture...) would help ground our understanding of specific concepts in Japanese modernism.

Strengths: Four papers, no exams, small class for intimate discussion.

Weaknesses: I felt like the class would be infinitely better if we received a few classes worth of contextualization for this literary era; I found it hard to delve into texts in which I didn't feel particularly knowledgable about the history.
Absolutely, its a wonderful class. Seth and Young are amazing
